home.programs.allInclusive: Our ALL INCLUSIVE program offers a complete and unforgettable experience, which includes all the hotel expeditions, an open bar with a wide variety of options, access to our entire  food menu, both restaurant and bar, and transfers in and out from the hotel.
home.programs.fullBoard: The FULL BOARD program is specially designed for those independent guests, who want to enjoy all the comforts of our hotel but with the freedom to manage their own transfers and expeditions.
home.expeditions.bajada: We invite you to browse, learn and plan your future experience, in rio serrano hotel + spa we have more than 20 expeditions, divided into these 5 categories.
home.rooms.bajada: In rio serrano hotel + spa we have the responsibility to satisfy and customize your stay, we offer three types of rooms with different services but keeping the same standards of comfort and connectivity.
home.rooms.superior.bajada: Executive suites with separate bedrooms and living rooms with natural light in a spacious space are truly suites where you can experience a modern lifestyle
home.rooms.standarplus.bajada: Executive suites with separate bedrooms and living rooms with natural light in a spacious space are truly suites where you can experience a modern lifestyle
home.rooms.standar.bajada: Executive suites with separate bedrooms and living rooms with natural light in a spacious space are truly suites where you can experience a modern lifestyle
home.gastronomy.title: Gastronomy
home.gastronomy.bajada: If you are looking for the character of a Patagonian cuisine committed to its roots and represented by its products, río serrano hotel + spa is the right place, where memories, stories, traditions and tastes mix together through an interpretation inspired by the end of the world. In this way, our gastronomy achieves balance and harmony through its presentation, aroma and texture, especially to enjoy with family, friends, or a romantic evening.
home.gastronomy.descripcionChef: Inspired by the Patagonian nature and the rhythm of its seasons, Walter Leal transforms our KAIENK restaurant into a space of unique creations.
home.historia.bajada: Rio Serrano hotel + spa is a regional and family business founded by Jaime Arancibia Tagle, who by profession created a project for tourism purposes in a remote place in Torres del Paine national park. It began its operations in 2002 as a 20-room Hostel and, over time it became a 108-room hotel, being considered today as the tourist complex with the best infrastructure in Torres del Paine.
home.historia.2000: Jaime Arancibia makes one of the first visits to the sector.
home.historia.2005: With 56 rooms, we became Rio Serrano Hotel.
home.historia.2008: We became the hotel with the largest capacity in Torres del Paine with 95 rooms.
home.historia.hoy: We are a company dedicated to deliver tourist experiences in Patagonia, in río serrano hotel + spa we stand before the challenges and changes of our industry, constantly improving to continue being leaders in the region.
programs.ai.bajada: Río serrano hotel + spa offers different programs to satisfy the most varied tastes and interests of our guests, which will maximize the value of your time with us. We invite you to read the options of our ALL INCLUSIVE program so you can start planning your trip through the magical Chilean Patagonia.

programs.fb.bajada: Río serrano hotel + spa offers different programs to satisfy the most varied tastes and interests of our guests, which will maximize the value of your time with us. We invite you to read the options of our FULL BOARD program so you can start planning your trip through the magical Chilean Patagonia.
programs.fb.list.item2: Traslado IN/OUT desde Punta Arenas, Puerto Natales y Cerro Castillo a Hotel Río Serrano.
programs.fb.list.item4: Desayuno Buffet, Almuerzo y Cena (Acompañado de bebestibles: Jugos, Aguas, Gaseosas o Vino de la casa por copa).
programs.fb.list.item5: Entradas al Parque Nacional Torres del Paine.
programs.fb.list.item6: Expediciones con guía Bilingüe (Expediciones del Hotel).
programs.fb.list.item8: WIFI en habitación y áreas comunes.
programs.fb.list.item9: Acceso a SPA con piscina temperada.
programs.fb.resumen1: El programa ALL INCLUSIVE otorga a nuestros pasajeros la comodidad de optar por la variada gama de trekkings y actividades que tendrán acceso gracias a nuestros transfer a los puntos de interés, todas las comidas, consumos en nuestro Bar, Descuento en 1 relajante masaje y además los transfer desde y hacia Punta Arenas y Puerto Natales.
programs.fb.resumen2: Nuestros programas All Inclusive, están diseñados para satisfacer los más variados gustos e intereses en la Patagonia Chilena, que le permitirán maximizar el valor de su tiempo con nosotros y disfrutar en profundidad cada rincón del Parque Nacional Torres del Paine y sus alrededores.

programs.fb.detalle.cabeza.bajada: Gorro de lana, cuello de polar, anteojos para sol con protección UV y bloqueador solar.
programs.fb.detalle.piernas.bajada: Calzas de fibra de secado rápido, pantalón repelente al agua (Gore-tex), shorts para cuando hace calor.
programs.fb.detalle.parteSuperior.bajada: Camiseta de secado rápido, chaqueta de polar o leece, chaqueta repelente al agua, guantes.
programs.fb.detalle.pies.bajada: Calcetines de polar o polipropileno y zapatos de trekking.
spa.header.bajada: The aroma of nature and the constant flow of the waters of the Serrano River create a relaxing atmosphere, transmitting a peace and tranquility feeling.
spa.slider.bajada: In 2018 we opened our Spa which has a climatized pool, sauna, massages, gym, rest areas, dressing rooms and an impressive view of the Paine massif. This is a space where you can enjoy facial and body treatments, manicures, pedicures and various massages. The Spa is a 3-level, 1,100 m² building, which identifies with the Aonikenk and Kawésqar culture, indigenous people of the region who inhabited these Patagonian lands 10,000 years ago.
spa.environment.ambiente.bajada: Every corner of this place honors and remembers the ancient heritage of our ancestors
spa.massage.bajada: We are privileged to travel through these southern lands, but its nature is often hostile and body demanding, due to this, the Aónikenk and Kawésqar painted their skin to protect it from the wind and sun. We invite you to live the experience of rituals, treatments and massages inspired by the culture of our ancestors.
spa.pool.bajada: Immerse your body and mind in pure sensations due to the waters that flow from the ancient glaciers through the Serrano River, which directly nourish this pool.
rooms.superior.bajada: A perfect mix between space, comfort and the best view of the Paine massif. Our superior room has a large window, which will give you the privilege of admiring the Serrano river and the majestic Torres del Paine mountains.
rooms.superior.detalle: In this room you will have the option of choosing between 1 king bed and 2 twin beds, with the option of adding a third bed. The superior room has a closet, telephone, safe-deposit box and bathroom with shower, amenities and hairdryer.
rooms.superior.culturas.bajada: Our Superior room is decorated with regional elements and colors, such as the characteristic leather of the Magellanic Estancias, the wood, which symbolizes harmony, creativity and temperance, and the brown color that brings the feeling of comfort.
rooms.superior.detalles.bajada: Decorated with elements of the area, specially selected fabrics and leathers, diversity of colors, wood and stones.
rooms.superior.vistas.bajada: Inglés Donec imperdiet, dolor nec imperdiet tincidunt, dui dui congue dolor. Morbi rutrum id nisl eget pulvinar.
rooms.standar.bajada: With a view of the snowy Mount Balmaceda, the Standard room has all the comforts to ensure a perfect stay.
rooms.standar.detalle: In this room you will have the option of choosing between 1 king bed or 2 twin beds. The Standard room has a closet, telephone, safe-deposit box and bathroom with shower, amenities and hairdryer.
rooms.standar.culturas.bajada: Our Standard room is decorated with Patagonian elements and colors, with the arrow as its main symbol, which inspired protection for our ancestors. On the other hand, the gray color will provide an atmosphere of balance and harmony during your stay.
rooms.standar.detalles.bajada: Decorated with elements of the area, specially selected fabrics and leathers, diversity of colors, wood and stones.
rooms.standar.vistas.bajada: Inglés Donec imperdiet, dolor nec imperdiet tincidunt, dui dui congue dolor. Morbi rutrum id nisl eget pulvinar.
rooms.plus.bajada: The perfect place to enjoy the stars and the Paine massif, accompanied by the beginning of the southern ice fields. Standard Plus is the indicated room to understand the strength of the wind and the infinite rain that our Patagonia offers.
rooms.plus.detalle: In this room you will have the option of choosing between 1 king bed or 2 twin beds. The Standard Plus room has satellite television, closet, telephone, safe-deposit box and bathroom with shower, amenities and hairdryer.
rooms.plus.culturas.bajada: Our Standard Plus room is decorated with the characteristic symbols and colors of Patagonia, also, is inspired by an important element for our lives, the tree, which will give us a feeling of peace and positivism.
rooms.plus.detalles.bajada: Decorated with elements of the area, specially selected fabrics and leathers, diversity of colors, wood and stones.
rooms.plus.vistas.bajada: Inglés Donec imperdiet, dolor nec imperdiet tincidunt, dui dui congue dolor. Morbi rutrum id nisl eget pulvinar.

expeditions.specialescalada.bajada: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.specialescalada.video.bajada: Patagonia has a breeze of adventure due to its imposing vertical granite walls which lead us to imagine the view that experienced climbers observe from the summits.
expeditions.specialescalada.card.text: The climbing area that we will visit is 1.5 kms away, heading west of the Rio Serrano hotel, we will approach by vehicle to reach the Nutria river area. Once there, we will walk through a pristine forest before we can see the rock wall and the routes that we will climb. After a safety class and a climbing introduction  we will start with the first routes, gradually increasing the  difficulty, making you feel more confident about your skills to overcome any challenge. The view at the edge of the Nutria river will also allow us to see the Paine massif in the distance.
expeditions.specialphotosafari.bajada: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.specialphotosafari.video.baj: On board of an Mercedes Benz Unimog, specially modified for photography and nature lovers, you will be able to know the fauna and vegetation from the height, with a spectacular Patagonian dawn as main actor of this expedition.
expeditions.specialphotosafari.detalle.b: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.specialphotosafari.card.text: We will start at dawn with the goal of increasing the chances of seeing active animals and appreciate the sunrise  that only a few are lucky to see. During the excursion we will stop in certain places and,  with the guide, we will begin the search for local fauna. We will take special care since we will be seen as real intruders in this puma dominated environment, the andean lion. Finally, we will arrive to Azul lagoon where we will take a break to enjoy a barbecue while observing a different perspective of the national park.
expeditions.trekkingbasetorres.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingbasetorres.video.baj: One of the most demanding expeditions and part of the famous W circuit of the Paine massif. We will move to the northeast side of the Torres del Paine national park until we reach Estancia Cerro Paine, then we will begin the journey through the Ascencio valley until we get to the iconic view of the three Torres del Paine and its lagoon of glacial origin.
expeditions.trekkingbasetorres.detalle.b: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingbasetorres.card.text: After crossing the Ascencio river, we will start the ascent though one of the shoulders of Almirante Nieto mountain (2600 m.a.s.ll) towards a windy pass called Paso de los Vientos, here we will enjoy the panoramic view of the surroundings. Then we will begin the descent to the Chileno mountain refuge, where we will have already completed 3 kms. After passing the mountain refuge we will continue our hike surrounded by forests of Lengas and glacier water springs, until arriving to the last flat sector (550 m.s.n.m). After a short break, we will ascend about 300 mt. (1 hour) through the complicated moraine, this being the last km. of the trail. Finally we will reach Las Torres del Paine and its turquoise periglacial lagoon, the landscape that turns the national park into the eighth wonder of the world.
expeditions.trekkingcordonchacabuco.baja: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingcordonchacabuco.vide: Aimed to the lovers of  forests and less visited places; this excursion, exclusive from our hotel, is full of ancient vegetation, such as lengas, cipreses and ñirre. In Chacabuco you will find a place full of peace and quietness, with a  great variety of birds where the Magellanic woodpecker stands out.
expeditions.trekkingcordonchacabuco.deta: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingcordonchacabuco.card: At the outskirts of Torres del Paine national park we can find Chacabuco mountain range, which we will cross by walking from the hotel. Gradually, we will discover a forest that, due to the geographical area in which is located, keeps a  varied ecosystem of fungi, lichens and bryophytes. During most of the trail we will be surrounded by this forest, which will allow us to see at certain times the Río Serrano village, rivers and the Paine massif. Once the steepness start to increase, we will begin our return to the hotel while we observe the pristine nature of our Patagonian forests.
expeditions.horseridingtwohours.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.horseridingtwohours.video.ba: A horseback ride that will make you experience the culture of Patagonia. We have very tame and friendly horses appropriate for all ages. On the way we will cross a river, forests and we will be able to see the Paine massif at all times.
Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.horseridingtwohours.card.tex: Patagonia, land of Gauchos, with whom we will explore the area of Rio Serrano village  in a horseback ride which last around two hours. We will start in the horse stable of the hotel where we will have an introduction class of the fundamental principles of how to ride. In the first part, we will go to an ancient Magellanic forest surrounded by trees of the species Nothofagus and endemic shrubs like the calafate, in addition to observe different species of birds. We will cross a small lagoon on our horses heading towards the Serrano river, where we will stop to take some photographs to immortalize the moment, with the imposing Paine massif in the background.
expeditions.horseridingpntp.bajada: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.horseridingpntp.video.bajada: Una de las expediciones más exigente y parte del famoso circuito W del macizo Paine. Nos trasladamos hacia el noreste del Parque Nacional Torres del Paine hasta llegar a Estancia Cerro Paine.
expeditions.horseridingpntp.detalle.baja: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.horseridingpntp.card.text: La actividad más icónica de todo el parque. Nos internaremos a través del Valle del Ascencio, en honor al renombrado bandido de la Patagonia de principios del siglo pasado. Bosques centenarios de lengas nos conducirán a la base de la morrena frontal dejada por el antiguo avance del Glaciar Torres, donde ascenderemos para alcanzar las imponentes Torres del Paine y su laguna a los pies de estas.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorferrier.bajad: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorferrier.video: This tour is considered one of the most attractive and challenging within the park. When we reach the top of the mountain,  we will enjoy  a panoramic view of the Grey, Nordenskjold, Pehoé and Sarmiento lakes. In addition, we will witness the wonderful southern ice fields.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorferrier.detal: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
The ascent start from 50 m.a.s.l to 700 m.a.s.l. A physically demanding trail, recommended for those who like challenges, and enjoy the feeling of being immersed in one of the oldest forests in the area and with one of the best views of the park. From this place we will have a panoramic view of most of the park, with glaciers such as Grey and Pingo glaciers, and several of the lakes that are part of this remote corner of the region.
expeditions.trekkingchorrillopingo.bajad: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingchorrillopingo.video: The trekking starts in the Grey ranger station, where we will slowly head towards the Pingo valley bordering the Pingo river. This area is one of the least affected by human intervention and where the vegetation has not been affected by the fires.
expeditions.trekkingchorrillopingo.detal: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
After crossing the Pingo valley we will go to one of the oldest forests in the park, where we will walk through the Magellanic forest, characterized by its diverse colors and aromas, which will be with us throughout the day. The trail has no major inclinations, however we must be careful since the place is known to be one of the most humid with a lot of muddy terrain. After 2.5 hours we will reach the end of the trail where we will find a small stream of water, known as Chorrillo de los Salmones. During the excursion we will enjoy landscapes such as the Paine Grande and Cuernos del Paine, and if we are lucky we will see a huemul, the andean deer.
expeditions.trekkingcascadapingo.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingcascadapingo.video.b: One of the most demanding expeditions and part of the famous W circuit of the Paine massif. We move to the northeast of Torres del Paine National Park until we reach Estancia Cerro Paine.
expeditions.trekkingcascadapingo.detalle: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. expeditions.trekkingcascadapingo.card.te: The most iconic activity in the whole park. We will go through the Ascencio Valley, in honor of the renowned bandit of Patagonia at the beginning of the last century. Centennial forests of lengas will lead us to the base of the front moraine left by the old Torres Glacier, where we will ascend to reach the imposing Torres del Paine and its lagoon at the foot of these.

expeditions.trekkingsaltoserrano.card.te: The most iconic activity in the whole park. We will go through the Ascencio Valley, in honor of the renowned bandit of Patagonia at the beginning of the last century. Centennial forests of lengas will lead us to the base of the front moraine left by the old Torres Glacier, where we will ascend to reach the imposing Torres del Paine and its lagoon at the foot of these.
expeditions.trekkinglagunaescondida.baja: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkinglagunaescondida.vide: We start the trail walking from the hotel in southern direction towards the lower part of the Chacabuco mountain range. From here we will start a one hour trail  which will take us through a beautiful forest of lengas, the main tree of the area. Little by little we will reach altitude that will allow us to see the interesting geography that surrounds the Rio Serrano village.
expeditions.trekkinglagunaescondida.card: We will walk from the hotel towards the beginning of the trail, from there here we will start the ascent until arriving to a flat place characterized by having a large tree of lenga, this is an excellent place to appreciate the Río Serrano village and the Paine massif. During most of the trail we will have a view of the mountain and a great mass of ice called the Grey glacier. At the end of the trail we will arrive to a beautiful lagoon called Escondida lagoon, here we will see birds like gray hooded sierra-finch, rufous-collared sparrow, woodpecker, thrush and the majestic condor. The way back will be by the same way and it will take us about 1 hour.

To reach this viewpoint we must face a short but complicated climb of 250 meters, and be prepared to climb steep slopes on stony trails experiencing the unique wind of Patagonia.

Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorcondor.card.t: We will start the trail ascending 2 km. from the Pehoé campsite, located on the shores of the lake of the same name. After traveling 100 meters we will arrive to a flat terrain, where we will take a rest while we contemplate in all its splendor the  Pehoé lake. After recovering our forces we will continue our journey until we are between two mountains, which will cause the winds to increase when under pressure from the space reduction. Once reached the summit of the viewpoint we will have a panoramic view of Pehoé lake with its striking waters and the imposing Paine massif.
expeditions.trekkingmiradortoro.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingmiradortoro.video.ba: A panoramic view of the national park and its hydrographic network, on this trail we will admire how the Paine river, one of the rivers that crosses the national park, drain into Toro lake, the largest lake in the region.
Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingmiradortoro.card.tex: We will start the day by  leaving the hotel heading north towards the national park, after traveling for 20 minutes we will cross the Paine river through the Weber bridge. From this point we will start the trail, in which during its first stage we will see  the vegetation and the characteristic blue color of the Paine river. As the trail increases in altitude we will have a better view of the park and its surroundings. Finally we will reach  the highest part of the mountains, very close to the viewpoint, where we will see the Toro lake, the Río Serrano village, the Paine massif and the source of the Serrano river.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorcuernos.bajad: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorcuernos.video: What outstand the most about the Paine massif are its stunning Cuernos del Paine, a fusion of black sedimentary rock along with granite walls that make this view one of the most impressive in the world.
expeditions.trekkingmiradorcuernos.detal: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
This excursion is a perfect option to enjoy the central area of the park in a smooth and simple hike. We will drive along the shore of Pehoé lake  for a few kilometers before starting our excursion. The trail begins with the view of the Salto Grande, a beautiful waterfall that connect the Nordenskjold and Pehoé lakes.  During the trail we will see Mount Paine Grande,  the Francés valley and glacier,  and a big variety of bushes. Finally we will be very close to the unique and imposing Cuernos del Paine, a classic landscape for all those who visit this remote corner of our continent.
expeditions.trekkingaonikenk.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingaonikenk.video.bajad: The trail does not present major difficulty and steep slopes, so it is highly recommended if you are looking for a smooth walk. During the excursion we will learn about the old inhabitants of the area, the ones who inspired the name of this trail.
expeditions.trekkingaonikenk.card.text: From the hotel it will take us 1 hour to reach the beginning of the trail, where we will start the walk with a view to the Sarmiento lake. Once we get to the highest point of the trail we will find a rock cluster which contain cave paintings of more than 7,000 years made by the ancient natives who inhabited this area. The place invites us to imagine how life was for these men and women in the past and how they lived in perfect harmony with the environment. During the walk it is possible to observe different species of birds, foxes, guanacos, and the typical landscapes of the Patagonian steppe.
expeditions.trekkingplayasarmiento.bajad: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingplayasarmiento.video: This excursion will take us to a lake which  helds relevant information about the beginnings of life on earth, here you will learn about the evolution and changes that our atmosphere has experienced to finally give way to the human being.
We will start our excursion taking a transfer for 50 minutes in northwest direction of the hotel to find the beginning of the trail. During the trip we will witness how the vegetation changes and how the guanacos, foxes and different birds appear. Through the edge of Sarmiento Chico lake, we will reach our goal, Sarmiento lake, the largest within the park, characterized by an intense blue color and distinct calcium carbonate formations along its entire coast, This is an organic structure, beautiful and unique in appearance due to its formation and composition. Finally, we will start our way back with a view of the Cuernos del Paine.
expeditions.trekkingsenderogrey.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingsenderogrey.video.ba: There is no better way to know the vastness of a glacier than to hike towards it, this is another excursion that is part of the W circuit.
Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingsenderogrey.card.tex: The day begins in the Pudeto sector to take the catamaran that will drop us off in Paine Grande mountain refuge, from here we will start walking towards the Grey valley bordering mountains, lagoons and the Grey lake. The type of terrain in some areas presents loose stones and mud. The difficulty level of this trail is high since we will face constant climbs with a high degree of incline and steep descents. It is certainly not an easy path, but the view that awaits us towards the end will make any effort be rewarded.
expeditions.trekkingsenderocuernos.bajad: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingsenderocuernos.video: This is another trail that is part of the Paine massif W circuit. Bordering Nordenskjold lake, we will move from Estancia Cerro Paine to the west  towards Cuernos del Paine.
expeditions.trekkingsenderocuernos.detal: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
The trail begins along the southern side of Mount Almirante Nieto and the northern side of Nordenskjold lake, which will surprise us with the striking color of its waters. The unevenness of the trail will not be a challenge for us, but probably the strong wind will become part of our day giving the adventure factor to our hike. After 11 kms. we will reach our destination, where we will find an astonishing view of the Cuernos del Paine and the colorful Nordenskjold lake, from here we will be close to the heart of the Paine massif, making us feel part of the immensity of its mountains.
expeditions.trekkingcampoesmeralda.bajad: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingcampoesmeralda.video: Located at the base of mount Donoso , in a remote area of the park we find Esmeralda field. After a boat tour along the Serrano river  we will arrive to the Esmeralda dock, starting a hike around the Magellanic forest until we reach our destination.
expeditions.trekkingcampoesmeralda.detal: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
We will start our excursion by walking to our dock, located on the banks of the Serrano river to start the zodiac adventure. We will navigate on the confluence of the Grey and Serrano rivers, witnessing the fusion of their colors. After 20 minutes on board we will land at Esmeralda dock to continue the excursion, from here we will start a low difficulty trail surrounded by ñirres and lengas. This will take us to the Esmeralda field, a unique and solitary place located southwest of the national park, from there we will have a privileged view to the Andes mountain range and the Paine massif.
expeditions.trekkinglazoweber.bajada: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkinglazoweber.video.baja: In this excursion we will have an incredible view of the Paine massif and we will observe from different perspectives the Torres del Paine national park. After a long hike through forests of ñirres, lengas and coihues, we will have enjoyed marvelous views of the Verde and Sarmiento lagoon, Toro and Pehoé lakes.
expeditions.trekkinglazoweber.detalle.ba: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkinglazoweber.card.text: We leave the hotel by transfer to Estancia Lazo (2.15 hrs.) located in the eastern side of the park, from here we will have a panoramic view of the Verde lagoon. We will start the trail surrounded by magellanic forest, with the possibility to see a great variety of flora and fauna. Then, we will continue walking until arriving to our main goal, Toro lookout, from there we will observe the Toro lake, how the waters of the Paine river drains into it, and the source of the Serrano river. After this wonderful view we will have a hard descent, which will take us to the end of the excursion at the Weber bridge.
expeditions.navigationsglaciargrey.bajad: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.navigationsglaciargrey.video: This activity is a must during your visit to Torres del Paine national park. On this 3 hour navigation we will know one side of the southern ice fields.
expeditions.navigationsglaciargrey.detal: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
The excursion will begin in a 30 minutes transfer until arriving to the Grey ranger station, from here we will walk 1,5 kms. through the Grey beach, where we will see icebergs that have broken off  the great mass of ice. Then we will take the boat Grey III in which we will enjoy a unique landscape composed by  floating icebergs, lush vegetation and imposing mountains. At the end of the navigation we will meet the fantastic Grey glacier, one of the many arms that broke off  the enormous southern Patagonian ice field, it is a must see spectacle that will surely give us an unforgettable postcard.
expeditions.trekkingvallefrances.bajada: Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.trekkingvallefrances.video.b: Another iconic scenery inside the  Paine massif is the Francés valley, the friendliest trail within the W circuit, it is a must for those who enjoy nature and the diversity of landscapes.
expeditions.trekkingvallefrances.detalle: In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.trekkingvallefrances.card.te: In the Pudeto sector we will board the catamaran to navigate Pehoé lake for 30 minutes. We will arrive at Paine Grande mountain refuge and from here we will start the hike towards the heart of the massif, having the imposing Cuernos del Paine in the background. This stage of 7.6 kms. (2.5 hrs.) will take us to the Italiano campsite, where we will have an altitude variation between 60 and 200 (m.a.s.l). After passing this camp we will continue ascending 250 mts. (1.5 hrs.) surrounded by Magellanic forest and the glacier moraine; At the end of this trail we will finally arrive at the Francés lookout where we will have a 360º view of the park.
expeditions.navigationsrioserrano.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
This activity is an excellent opportunity to know the hydrography of the Torres del Paine national park. Through a zodiac navigation along the Serrano river we will get to the southwest sector of the park, reaching a small waterfall known as Salto Serrano.
expeditions.navigationsrioserrano.detall: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.navigationsrioserrano.card.t: During the boat ride we will see the Paine massif, flora and local birds, also, we will navigate on the confluence with the Grey river until arriving to the Salto Serrano. After a short walk we will reach a viewpoint and from here we will see the Andes mountain range, the Paine massif and also the Mount Balmaceda , located in the Bernardo O'Higgins national park. On our way back to the hotel we will navigate through the confluence of the Serrano and Nutria rivers, in addition to know the sport fishing zones, this journey will last about 25 min.
expeditions.fulldaypaine.bajada: Inglés Morbi cursus arcu sit amet odio pulvinar sollicitudin. Pellentesque magna neque, condimentum id dignissim vel, scelerisque in leo. Mauris aliquam leo lectus. Sed vel posuere neque. Aliquam semper justo maximus, maximus lorem in, pharetra lectus.
expeditions.fulldaypaine.video.bajada: This excursion is aimed to everyone who wants to get to know the national park completely without taking long walks. Full Day Paine, invites us to discover the secrets of our nature in a magic place, full of breathtaking landscapes.
expeditions.fulldaypaine.detalle.bajada: Inglés In laoreet iaculis euismod. Nulla interdum cursus elit sit amet scelerisque. Vivamus faucibus a mauris in interdum. Nulla placerat luctus massa sed tincidunt. Aenean quis interdum mi, ut finibus leo. Nulla in pretium libero. Donec eu rhoncus nunc. Nam ut molestie sem. Sed eget nisi sagittis erat tempor dignissim.
expeditions.fulldaypaine.card.text: We will go to the east side of the park to reach the hydrographic basin of Paine river, the main water source of the sector. We will go to the Salto Grande viewpoint, where the waters of Nordenskjold lake flow into  Pehoé lake, accompanied by the imposing view of the Cuernos del Paine. We will continue the excursion where we will have a view of Sarmiento lake, Nordenskjold lake and the Patagonian steppe, a place inhabited by guanacos, foxes and birds; and at the end of the first part of this trail we will have  magnificent landscape of the Torres del Paine. We will return to the hotel to have lunch, and then in the afternoon we will continue in west direction until arriving to the Grey ranger station, from here, we will begin a treking of  1 hour to explore the Grey beach where we will see the Grey glacier  and large icebergs on the lake.

contact.detail.bajada: The Hotel owes its name to the meandering Serrano River that rises from the waters of Lake Toro and flows into the Last Hope Sine. Its privileged location in front of the Torres del Paine and surrounded by a wonderful natural environment, provides the perfect combination of design, quality and comfort while respecting the balance with its surroundings.
